review: Amazon Fire TV Stick is awesome! As a streaming TV lover who ditched cable TV, it's considerably faster than a Roku when using the remote. Although honestly, my Roku offers many MORE channels so it's got some definite advantages there. But, based on the sheer tiny size of the Fire Stick, it will be easy to travel with. I got the stick on special offer for Amazon Prime members and seriously, I thought I'd be giving this thing away as a gift. I wasn't even expecting to LIKE it. But, nope! I'm keeping it right here on the living room TV. I'm sure Amazon will add more channels along the way.
author: Taylor in Michigan

review: We like having this - especially when our kids are home as they are movie freaks.  However, we needed a longer cord for it to be able to hook it up, and if you don't have great internet speed, you get times when you either can't access the movie or there are buffering times during the movie.  The selection seems good to me - but I'm not a huge movie buff.  (We did get to watch Mockingjay II in the comfort of our own home before it was released on DVD.  For a fee, but cheaper than going to the movies or buying the DVD.)  If you have really hot internet, this is probably fabulous!
author: Sue "suezieqt"
